name: Beachway Resort

reviews.text: This place is old and needs to be renovated. I was not comfortable there and we left, but received no money back. I did not see many bugs, but I can see what other reviewers are saying.
reviews.title: Not very nice

reviews.text: We just stayed for three days in the economy family suite. Very nice hotel, old, with alot of character. Friendly staff and very clean. Nice swimming pool. Could use an outside hot tub next to the pool. Poor breakfast with good fruit but with Hostess mini donuts.
reviews.title: Does the job

reviews.text: We just returned from a family reunion of 14 adults and 11 children. The kids ranged in age from toddler to teenager. We all stayed at the Beachway in different sizes and types of rooms. I highly recommend it to anyone going to Saugatuck.
reviews.title: Great for Families

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and the buildings and pool are very clean. Everything is in walking distance although the beach is quite a hike for toddlers and as someone pointed out there are no sidewalks.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is exactly as their website shows it. The staff was very friendly. As some of the other review stated, the hotel is a little dated, but the rooms were well kept/clean. The hotel is in a perfect location between the beach and town. We stayed with our two small children (2 and 5) and they enjoyed themselves as well. We will defintely be back.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, great location
Beachway Resort-Bed Bugs and more....
reviews.text: We arrived at the Beachway Resort and got settled into one of the efficiences. Expensive but thought why not. The next day coming back from the small pool we were told to report to the office. The owner told us we had to vacate the room (we had purchased food etc), because the suite had bed bugs! We were then told by the owner that there was no other suite available. We were understandably upset and the owner kept saying it was not her fault. I understood it was not her fault but her cleaning staff should have changed the bed sheets and noticed the bed bugs. My sister who was with on the vacation has multiple disabilities. The next day, she had bad bug bites on her back. The owner did help us find another place to stay but not after complaining and being rude. We have photos of her bed bug bites but never pursued anything with the owner. The onwer is nasty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a lovely weekend in one of the 1 BR condos located directly on the water. We loved the fact there was a kitchen with a microwave where you could heat leftovers up for a midnight snack. The bathroom was huge with a whirlpool tub for two. The bed was comfortable, it was great to wake up and have coffee overlooking the river. I think these condos are one of the nicer lodging options Saugatuck has to offer. Would definitely do it again!!
reviews.title: Great stay at the Beachway Condos

likes.liked: — Very Clean, Very comfortable, Nice owners

reviews.text: July 2007 was our second stay at the Beachway. It's a very kid-friendly place, moderately priced, with a great location. It's very close to the beach and just a quick ferry ride away from downtown Saugatuck. We were able to walk everywhere! The hotel itself is far from luxurious, but it's clean, the pool area is nice, the staff is friendly and accommodating, and you can't beat having a kitchen area. I would suggest that you bring your own pillows and towels, since the ones at the hotel leave a lot to be desired. All in all, we have had great experiences at the Beachway and will return next year.
reviews.title: Great location, great for families

reviews.text: We made a last minute reservation the week of the 4th of July holiday and were given the last available room next to the pool. The room had a king and pullout queen. The room was tidy and adequate with a good size bath. Our room (30) overlooked the pool and had a nice table and chairs outside which we used often. A mini fridge was in the room as well. We were within an easy walking distance of Mt Baldi and the chain ferry which we used to reach town (operated until 9:00 p.m. that week which was fine for dinner with children). It was also an easy drive to Douglas and Oval Beach. The pool was a nice temperature and clean, the only downside being the traffic going to and from Oval Beach. There are several outside seating areas for enjoying morning coffee or ordering in dinner to enjoy on property. There are muffins and coffee for breakfast - plenty since there are so many good restaurants to try in the area. Pool towels, paperbacks and videos are provided at no charge and the staff was polite and helpful. While you do not have a totally unobstructed view of the river and harbor, it is fun to glimpse all the huge boats making their way on the river. You could also stroll down to the museum and make use of their picnic table, garden and riverside pier for a closer look. All in all we had a great stay and will return next year.
reviews.title: Great last minute stay
Lovely!
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel a couple of summers ago. It is in a great location overlooking the water. They also have a nice pool if you don't want to go to the beach which is about a mile away.

Steps from the chain ferry to downtown Saugatuck, and maybe a half mile down the road from Oval Beach. Two large outdoor heated pools. Free donuts and fruit for breakfast. The wife, our 9-month old, and I stayed for 3 nights in their room up the hill which included a separate living room and kitchenette. Met all our needs very well. Wouldn't recommend it for anyone who doesn't like a lot of stairs - seemed like at least a few stairs up to just about every room, to get to ours was a hike up a steep driveway then more stairs.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took the Star of Saugatuck paddlewheel tour, nice, relaxing way to spend 1.5 hours.
reviews.title: Room with a view but.....

reviews.text: We booked the efficiency room along the river during the Holland tulip festival. The convenience of the efficiency was great and we enjoyed the view of the river from the balcony.
reviews.title: Excellent option for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest disappointment was the condition of the room. Although it was not dirty, it was sure well-worn in many aspects that is just pure maintenance related in rental property.
reviews.title: Just as good as advertised!

reviews.text: I would definitely try to book a room somewhere else in the vicinity first before coming back.
reviews.title: We return to the Beachway year after year

description: Overlooking the banks of the Kalamazoo River, the Beachway Resort is the closest hotel to Lake Michigan's Oval Beach. Take a ride on the only hand-cranked chain ferry in the US and spend a day shopping Saugatuck's shops and art galleries, or relax beside the sparkling heated pool! Enjoy some of our amenities such as our large heated swimming pool, movie library, board games and toys for children, guest computer and morning coffee & donuts.
